extendedInfo.description: Please send bugs to the support email with device type so it can be fixed! There are over 2200 Android devices, so it takes time to support them all. Thank you for your patience!A REAL interactive multi-sensor and data visualization scanner with a sci-fi look and feel. This scanner has 9 modules: Solar, Geo, Weather, Audio, Gyro, Mag, GPS, Cam, and Device, three of which are free. Full HD graphics!SOLAR MODULEGraphs the last 96 hours of solar wind plasma readings from the US ACE satellite and displays the most recent Solar X-ray. Measured parameters are Proton Density, Bulk Speed, and Ion Temperature.GEO MODULEDisplays animated global satellite data from NASA on a 3D globe. Last 10 months of land surface temp, sea surface temp, vegetation index, and chlorophyll concentration.WEATHER MODULEDisplays current meteorological conditions from closest weather station. Temperature, wind speed and direction, pressure, humidity, precipitation.AUDIO MODULE (requires low-latency hardware, experimental)Displays a spectrum readout of the microphone's audio, as well as current dB levels and Hz frequency. Some Android phones lag or crash on this feature (those without low-latency audio or with lots of background services running).MAG MODULEDisplays device-relative magnetometer readings. Comes with a spheroid visualization and raw microtesla vector and total field data.GPS MODULE (free)Displays WGS84-corrected coordinates on a 3D globe based on NASA satellite images. Zooms and rotates. Also displays readout of latitude, longitude, and altitude values and has a working compass.GYRO MODULE (free)Displays device attitude in real world space (3-axis bubble level). Includes gyro sphere pointing to world up and numerical data for world up vector.DEVICE MODULE (free)Displays device data (unique ID, system memory, graphics memory, graphics API, OS, processor name, number of cores, device name).CAM MODULE (experimental)Turns the scanner screen into a live movie feed. Also displays raw RGB levels of your phone's camera.QUALITY BUTTONAdds screen FX to simulate a CRT monitor. The noise and chromatic aberration effect tax the GPU, so "high Q" may not work on all phones.SND BUTTONToggle computer beeps and scan hums. RECOMMENDED TECH SPECS-Low-latency audio pipeline (for Audio Module only). This allows for live analysis of microphone data.-Screen resolution larger than 480x800, 300+ ppi.-If you experience crashes outside of the Audio module, quit other open applications (in Android's Settings menu) and try again, as this is typically due to an out-of-memory error. The app will also continue to be optimized over time to accommodate older phones.Verified on following devices:HTC Nexus OneMotorola ElectrifyLG RevolutionPhoton 4GSamsung Galaxy S3Cam Module may only show black on:Samsung Galaxy NexusSamsung Galaxy WLG Optimus Thrill 4GAsus Eee Transformer TF-101Motorola Droid-xHTC One XSHARP AQUOS PHONE 102SHNexus SAny phone without a camera (naturally)LEGALThis application is not in any way affiliated with any property other than that of its creator.

reviews.title: Good but could be better
reviews.comment: I\'m not a big fan of the cartoony design, it would be a lot more appealing if it made your device look like a tricorder. Consider using the newer tricorder touch screen like interface from elite force 2
reviews.author: Khaled El Manawhly

reviews.title: Good look
reviews.comment: It looks good but almost no functionality on the free app. The art is nice and it feels star trekish but the view of the useable data is a bit small of a percentage of the screen.
reviews.author: Fred M

reviews.title: Sci-scanner
reviews.comment: Love this app.  Major star trek fan.  Would like to see update to be able to take pictures or video in camera mode
reviews.author: Phillip Herring

reviews.title: Did a search for tricorder
reviews.comment: But this app came up, don\'t know why it\'s still linked to that keyword anymore. Maybe Paramont might have issues with this \"free\" app
reviews.author: alfred rodriguez

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: I think I would also like something with a larger screen.or maybe the ability to enlarge and shrink the current one. Still, the geek in me likes it.
reviews.author: jason ferrell

reviews.title: it\'s ok
reviews.comment: I don\'t get any altitude reading on my s3 and the barometer doesn\'t seem to work correctly either. I\'m not sure where it gets the weather feed but that seems to be wrong too. Needs work, but a good start. Fix these problems and you get five stars.
reviews.author: Graeme Taylor

reviews.title: Has great potential!
reviews.comment: I can see so much more going into this I bought the full app to try it out.  Love that it has actual info and being a star trek fan I love the tricorder look.  Adding more science and more planetary stuff would be cool too.
reviews.author: Matt Chism

reviews.title: Absolutely Free until you try and use it.
reviews.comment: Basically a scam to get you to pay for \"modules\" while ripping off star trek\'s IP. Sleazy.
reviews.author: Chaim Havinalaph

reviews.title: True Star Trek
reviews.comment: Looks great true to tng. Can\'t wait to see what\'s to come
reviews.author: Gregory Davis

reviews.title: Fun and actually useful
reviews.comment: What a fun idea...it actually has done really interesting tools that can be useful.  Works flawlessly on my Samsung galaxy s4   I\'d love to see a speedometer added
reviews.author: David Birdwell

reviews.title: Pretty rubbish
reviews.comment: This is a strange demo with little functionality. Seems greedy to ask for excessive amounts of money for pretty much every sensor but one. I don\'t have time for this kind of rubbish app that just wants to make money.   Uninstalled
reviews.author: William Martin

reviews.title: Great potential
reviews.comment: It is a great app, one less star for it not being finished
reviews.author: EpicGlitchman29 Plays

reviews.title: Dissatisfied
reviews.comment: Bought this last weekend, weather rarely loads.  Cool concept, poorly executed when it comes to displaying actual data.  Right now I consider this to be $5 I tossed out the window.
reviews.author: Mike Cox

reviews.title: Its ok
reviews.comment: Overall stability is better since last patch. Solar carts not auto scale. All readings today not visable.
reviews.author: Hans Schaefers

reviews.title: Excellent application.
reviews.comment: I really love this application. It could have more options, but then do could so many other things. Keep up the good work.
reviews.author: Jason Mackinnon

reviews.title: Little more than an advert
reviews.comment: Almost all features are disabled unless you buy the full version so this is essentially just an advert for that product.
reviews.author: Robin May

reviews.title: Awesome app
reviews.comment: Very cool look and feel with actual functionality.   In addition. To finishing beta features, you should add more solar photos in various wavelengths.
reviews.author: Etwal Gade

reviews.title: Good, sometimes great even.
reviews.comment: I liked the original iteration and have enjoyed each update/shuffle.  I have tricorder(now T-840) and I  like the functionalities of this tricorder better/more. And why you ask?  It makes me smile!
reviews.author: Jeff Hamilton

reviews.title: Fantastic but....
reviews.comment: The text is really small, even on my (somewhat) large screened huawei quad XL. It is really hard to read, even while wearing reading glasses... any chance on making the GPS location bigger? I would LOVE to use this app for my geocaching adventures, but with such small text, it is quite impractical.
reviews.author: James Cobalt

reviews.title: Buggy
reviews.comment: I was hoping for access to the sensors like elixer2 gives you, but with an lcars interface.   This is close but has maybe a tenth the features/data even after you unlock everything.  The hi res is probably supposed to show a spectroscopic graph of something, but doesn\'t appear to work at all. The app crashes a lot.  I\'m not really buying the memory explanation. Android closes things automatically to make room for the foreground app.  Also, my sgs3 has tons of ram.  Potentially a 5 star app.  Keep going!
reviews.author: Paul Miller
